info.title: Amiigo
info.author: CompSciOrBust
info.details:
Amiigo is a GUI for Emuiibo and a EmuGUIibo alternative that runs directly on the switch.

Controls
Up / Down on Dpad to move up and down the list.

A to select a Amiibo from the list.

X toggles emulation state.

Y moves on to the next Amiibo.

B enters the Amiigo Maker. Press B again to go back to the Amiibo selection UI.

You can also use the touch screen to select an Amiibo by tapping on a item in the list, tapping the emulation status rectangle will toggle the emulation state, and tapping the currently selected Amiibo on the top rectangle will move on to the next Amiibo.

changelog:
v2.4.1
- Fixed bug in which the name field of the JSON output was saved as an array of bytes instead of a string
  - Any Amiibos generated with version 2.4.0 will not work and must be regenerated.
  - This bug only affected version 2.4.0 and any Amiibos generated with prior versions are fine.

2.4.0
Changes to Amiigo:

Status bar now highlights when a status change occurs
Emuiibo version is now shown in the settings menu
Changed symbols used for special list entries
Reintroduced theme support
Added experimental support for downloading Amiibo images
Intended for use with Overlay
To enable manually edit the Amiigo config file to set saveAmiiboImages to true
Note: There is a known issue with Overlay where loading images which are too large will cause it to crash. In future versions of Amiigo I will resize images automatically to prevent this.
Removed AmiiboAPI downloading functionality
AmiiboAPI is shutting down on Dec 31st 2025
Amiigo will no longer attempt to download the API data on first launch
The "Update API cache" button has been removed since it will stop working once the API goes offline
Sanitised file paths when creating virtual Amiibos to fix a bug where certain Amiibos were uncreatable
Updated included API cache
Updated to latest Arriba
Changes to Arriba:

Fixed double text kerning bug
Added support for most unicode characters
